pageContext.claim: “And we've been there 19 years, and we're basically policemen. We're acting as police, as opposed to soldiers....They've done an incredible job, but, you know, they don't -- they're not allowed to fight to win.”
pageContext.analysis: Much of the U.S. mission in Afghanistan has involved training, but that isn't the same as acting as the country’s police force. Some have argued that “if we were ‘almost a police force’ in Afghanistan” the war would be over.
